{{Infobox football tournament season | title = Copa del Rey | year = 1911 | other_title = | image = | imagesize = | caption = | country = Spain | num_teams = 10 | defending champions = [[FC Barcelona]] | champions = [[Athletic Bilbao]] | runner-up = [[RCD Espanyol|CD EspaÃ±ol]] | matches = 8 | goals = 27 | top goal scorer = | player = | prevseason = [[1910 Copa del Rey|1910]] | nextseason = [[1912 Copa del Rey|1912]] }} The '''Copa del Rey 1911''' was the 9th staging of the [[Copa del Rey]]. The competition started on April 9, 1911 and concluded on April 15, 1911 with the Final, held at the [[Estadio Jolaseta]] in [[Getxo]], in which [[Athletic Bilbao]] lifted the trophy for the 5th time ever with a 3â1 victory over [[RCD Espanyol|CD EspaÃ±ol]]. This Tournament should had been 13 teams, but 3 teams withdrew, and another 3 teams withdrew during the competition. ==Controversies== [[Deportivo de La CoruÃ±a|RC Deportivo de la CoruÃ±a]] and Academia de Ingenieros withdrew the competition before it started. They were against fielding foreign players in the teams. During the tournament, there were more protests and withdrew threats of some teams. After the first round match between [[Athletic de Bilbao]] and [[Real Club Fortuna de Vigo|Fortuna Vigo]], Real Sociedad de FÃºtbol contested the match, claiming illegal lineup of two English players in Athletic de Bilbao. The Football Federation rejected the claim and Real Sociedad withdrew immediately. The rest of teams supported Real Sociedad and threatened to withdrew. Finally, Athletic decided not to lineup those players in their matches, but refused to replay the match against Fortuna. ==Preliminary round== {{footballbox | date = April 9, 1911 | team1 = [[Athletic Bilbao]] | score = 2–0 | team2 = [[Real Club Fortuna de Vigo|Fortuna Vigo]] | stadium = Josaleta Stadium, [[Getxo]] }} {{footballbox | date = April 9, 1911 | team1 = [[Bilbao FC]] | score = 2–1 | team2 = [[Academia de ArtillerÃ­a]] | stadium = Josaleta Stadium, [[Getxo]] }} ==Quarterfinals== {{footballbox | date = April 10, 1911 | team1 = [[RCD Espanyol|CD EspaÃ±ol]] | score = 6–0 | team2 = [[Academia de InfanterÃ­a]] | stadium = Josaleta Stadium, [[Getxo]] }} {{footballbox | date = April 10, 1911 | team1 = [[Academia de CaballerÃ­a]] | score = 1–0 | team2 = [[Santander FC]] | stadium = Josaleta Stadium, [[Getxo]] }} {{footballbox | date = April 12, 1911 | team1 = [[FC Barcelona]] | score = 4–0GimnÃ¡stica EspaÃ±ola comnplained about the lineup of FC Barcelona goalkeeper ReÃ±Ã©. The Football Federation ordered to replay the match, but FC Barcelona refused to do it claiming the lineup of English players in Athletic Bilbao. FC Barcelona was disqualified and GimnÃ¡stica EspaÃ±ola qualified for semifinals. | team2 = [[Sociedad GimnÃ¡stica EspaÃ±ola|Sociedad GimnÃ¡stica]] | stadium = Josaleta Stadium, [[Getxo]] }} {{footballbox | date = April 12, 1911 | team1 = [[Athletic Bilbao]] | score = 4–1 | team2 = [[Bilbao FC]] | stadium = Josaleta Stadium, [[Getxo]] }} ==Semifinals== {{footballbox | date = April 14, 1911 | team1 = [[Athletic Bilbao]] | score = 2–0Sociedad GimnÃ¡stica withdrew in the second half, with Athletic winning 2-0, in protest for the referee indulgence with Athletic foul play. | team2 = [[Sociedad GimnÃ¡stica EspaÃ±ola|Sociedad GimnÃ¡stica]] | stadium = Josaleta Stadium, [[Getxo]] }} {{footballbox | date = April 14, 1911 | team1 = [[RCD Espanyol|CD EspaÃ±ol]] | score = not playedAcademia de Artilleria, a military team, withdrew before the game because they were called to their regiment. | team2 = [[Academia de Artilleria]] | stadium = Josaleta Stadium, [[Getxo]] }} ==Final== {{main|1911 Copa del Rey Final}} {{footballbox| date= 15 April 1911| team1= [[Athletic Bilbao]] | score=3 –1 | report= | team2= [[RCD Espanyol|CD EspaÃ±ol]] | goals1= Zuazo {{goal}}
